intro: Jonesiopsis remota subsp. parva, commonly known as the small Jonesiopsis, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Arecaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked due to their size and subtle appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species with limited research on its ecological role.
